metadata.metaValue:
This updates the parent nodes and branches structs. 
We append new nodes when a node is growing or when new branch is generated.
Apply self weight on unattached branches.
Updates the nutrition values, leaf sizes, vein sizes of all nodes.

This ivy generator is a custom implementation based on 2 technical papers from Japanese researchers Ari Shindo, Yasunori Fukuta, Yuji Sakamoto.

生長シミュレーションによるツタのCGモデル生成
Model Generation for Climbing Plants Using Growth Simulation:
https://ipsj.ixsq.nii.ac.jp/ej/?action=pages_view_main&active_action=repository_view_main_item_detail&item_id=70750&item_no=1&page_id=13&block_id=8

屈光性および壁面の材質を考慮した生長シミュレーションによるナツヅタのCGモデル生成  
Model Generation for Japanese Ivy by Using Growth Simulation and Considering Phototropism and Wall Materials
https://www.jstage.jst.go.jp/article/itej/66/12/66_J516/_article/-char/ja/

Collect the node indices from which new nodes will be generated.
We collect each endpoint nodes if they collected enough nutrition.
We also collect none-endpoint that are valid candidates to generate branches from.

For each active nodes, we shoot random direction in a cone.
Each candidates are then evaluated against different tropism models.
The candidates with the highest scores are then selected for the current step.
Append the new node on the node array
we update each active node by disabling the is_endpoint.
Contruct the new nodes using its parents data.
Place the new node by adding the position to its parent node position
Use the new strand index if we spawn a node from a parent node that is not an endpoint.
Each new branch is tagged as endpoint, and has no child strand
update_length. Reset length if we grow from a node that is not an endpoint.
Update branch level. increment the branch level by 1 if we grow from a node that is not an endpoint.

resize the direction according to the step length. 
The new node will be this far relative to its parent.
Increment the counter when we grow from an end point. Reset the counter when we generate a new branch.
Update the hanging length; Kill the branch if an hanging length reaches its maximum length.

When we start to build a new branch, we add 2 nodes at onces in order to maintain continuity in the growth. 
The first node's position is the parent node position; length is 0, absolute length is the parent's absolute length.
We also set the has_child_branch tag true so that this node will not be active again.

Trick to avoid infinite poitn spawn. If a node is active, we check if it has already spawned a child strand. 
If so, It means that new node cannot be generated again from this node.

update the node states. 
If a point is spawned from an endpoint, it means that it has no child.
If a point is spawned from a point that is not an endpoint, 
it means that a new branch will be generated, so we tag has_child_branch true.
output the current parent node state and data
Increament the stand index list when we grow from a non-endpoint node.
Increament the stand index list when we grow from a non-endpoint node.

We use the new node index as the branch's first node index. 
Since we creates 2 nodes when a new branch is created, 
we also add its following index as the last node index.

Each new branch (level higher than 0) starts with two nodes.
We copy the generated node and use its parent node position.
We do this in order to have continuity.
We increment the parent branch child count.

increment the node node in the current branch.
update the current branch's last point index.

Updates the nutrition for all nodes from top to bottom.
Nutrition values are generated for each end point nodes.
Nutrition values are scaled according to the apical dominance and the branch level.
These values are then propageted to parent nodes until the plant's root is reached.
We do this by walking up in the hierachical tree (tips to roots).

update the nutrition for all nodes.
Nutrition values are scaled according to the apical dominance and the branch level.
Add nutrition relative to the branch level, apical dominance and nutrition step.
Convert nutrition to leaf and stem sizes.

For each new nodes, compute the node's scaled nutrition step,
walk its hierarchy and accumulate all node indices until the 
root is reached.

we can accumulate the scaled nutrition values in the nodes.
Each indices lists add their respective scaled nutrition to the nodes.
We repeat the operation for each indices lists.
We scale the nutrition step according the the nutrition factor.

This walk up in the plant's hierarchy starting from the last active node down.
We accumulate all the node indices until the root node index is reached.
This tags every nth node to be a bud that can potentially generate a branch.

walk each end point nodes hierarchy until we find the last attached point. 
All indices found during the walk are collected in an array, and used to collect the hanging branch's nodes.

Apply the self weight per branch and update the auxiliary data. 
During the update, we apply parallel transport on the unattached node's normal, and do a final collision check by sampling the closest accelerator.

This walk up in the plant's hierarchy starting from the last branch point. 
We accumulate all the node indices until the last attached node index is reached.
test if the falling branch intersect with geometry.
Apply the lever force on the branch.
While the moment is greater than the threshold, continue to iterate.
For each candidate directions, calculate their scores.
sample the surface accelerator and outpout sampled data.
Test if a point is inside the mesh.
Calculate the distance to surface scores
We set the score to -10 if a candiadate direction is detected inside or peneatrating a piece of geometry.
Tag the bud as dead if the surrounding shadows is greater than the threshold

When we try to grow a branch, we also add the previous node's position into the computation. The self_shadow sum of the two nodes is used to determinate if we can spawn or not.
This is the same as Ha and Hb in the paper.

we set the weight to 0 for nodes on the same branch.
By doing this, we ensure that we only calculate the 
light recieving vector and the shadow weight
from neigbor branch's nodes.
sum the distance weight to compute the self shadow value.
Get neighbors node positions, access positions and size informations.
If the leaf size is too small, we calculate from the stem size instead.
This check if the current growth direction may collide with auxiliary geometry. If it does, we increase the step angle.
